title: About Me!
text:
Hi, I’m Jazzmin Pearl Duncan—a media science student, writer, and curator passionate about the intersections of technology, digital media, and music culture. With a background in research, data teams, and storytelling, I explore how emerging technologies shape media production, intellectual property, and cultural expression.
I’m the Founder and Production Manager of Circuits, Internet, Media & Software (CIMS), a collective dedicated to celebrating the fusion of media and computer science through events, publications, and community-driven projects. My work spans journalism, law and policy writing, and software projects that engage with digital culture in innovative ways.
Currently, I’m contributing to p-RoomMatch, a smart roommate-matching platform, as part of the data team, and I’m a staff writer for the Claremont Journal of Law & Public Policy, where I focus on AI’s impact on music licensing and intellectual property law. I’m also a DJ, event planner, and multimedia artist with a love for experimental sounds, textile work, and digital collaging.
Through my work, I aim to blend technical insight with creative vision, fostering spaces where media, technology, and culture collide in meaningful ways.
Let’s connect and collaborate!

title: Website-Project
text: Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see https://quarto.org.

title: Website-Project
text: Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see https://quarto.org.

title: hello!
text:
Although this site only contains classwork now, I hope to further develop it as a landing page for my art portfolio, contains poetry, documentaries, digital art, and motion pictures, along with my more pride-inducing research papers, and perhaps, even a resume.
A preview of my poetry: act i: just what’s a wiz?, i’ll know soon as i get home (thoughts of an unemployed junior) and just what’s a wiz? what would i ask him? i look around me and see oz, walls full of graffiti and beautiful people but what’s in me? don’t know what i’m made of my brain is rotting out of my head and taking any vision of the future with it walk? you can’t walk. but i know i can, but where am i going? i am the turkey and i am blowing out my own flame. i am the crow. trash! t-rash! my mind collapses in on itself as i read every cover letter i write, application i submit, and writing sample i provide and so i lay back and **** that ****, and **** a glass of *** i can’t win, who am i competing against? the crow, haters? the wiz, fraud? my conscience, the invisible? the lines between reality and a demoralizing oz have become blurred by brainrot and repetitive fanaticism from ya novels the results of the first experiment, subject is a hopeless failure. you’re not you’re just the product of negative thinking. first we gotta get rid of these crows. you got it, clyde! i’m on my way to find the wiz, he’s gonna get me back home. i’m looking for where i end and the crows begin
Thanks for reading! The line breaks are a bit messed up because of formtting.
I really enjoyed this project and look forward to learning ore, nd experimenting with Quarto sites!

title: Cheese over Space and Animals
text:
Attaching package: 'dplyr'


The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':

    filter, lag


The following objects are masked from 'package:base':

    intersect, setdiff, setequal, union


`curl` package not installed, falling back to using `url()`
Rows: 1187 Columns: 19
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (17): cheese, url, milk, country, region, family, type, fat_content, cal...
lgl  (2): vegetarian, vegan

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.











This is a faceted bar chart demonstrating different eating habits across nations as it pertains to cheese. We can see that cows are substantially more centered in the dairy industry, while other milks, like water buffalo, go relatively unnoticed. You can also see countries in multiple different groups demonstrating both the breadth and nicheness of their cheeses, Italy being particularly noticible in this regard.
TidyTusedy dataset: https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/tree/a95bcce0d7e09590519ba1ff98512fbf10f443af/data/2024/2024-06-04
Data origins: cheese.com, a blog and resource for cheese lovers, collected this data.

title: Refuel Your Mind: Circle K for the Soul
